latestVersion.termsOfAccess:
Project files like raw data, coding guidelines and questionnaires can now be directly downloaded from this site.
Please see also SSD's Farm Household Survey Database (http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/).
latestVersion.dataAccessPlace: All files for this project/study, except for the Project Description, need to be directly downloaded from SSD's Farm Household Survey Database's online link: http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/

fields.value: Survey on Rice Cultivar Diversity and Yield Losses from Pests

dsDescriptionValue.value: A survey covering 19 major rice-producing provinces in the Philippines was conducted to determine rice yield loss caused by major insect pests, diseases and other biotic and abiotic stresses.  Analysis was done at the national and at the provincial level, the latter will determine the "hot spots" for major pests.

keywordValue.value: Collected and calculated: Proportion of area affected to the total area under rice cultivation- determines the insect and disease prevalence; normalized yield loss- gives the extent of the damage; and the probability of occurrence-gives an idea of the importance of the constraint.

fields.value: Subject: Number of Repondents  Type: Sample Size  Notes: 769;

value: 19 Major rice producing provinces in the Philippines
